title: Basics of Events Management
headline: Learn the various managerial strategies required to organise a successful event with this free online course.
description: Do you want to join the event management industry and become an event manager or planner? With the hectic work schedules and life we lead, everybody is short of time and energy to plan and execute an event. It has created a huge need and niche in the market for specialised event planners or managers. This course teaches you the basic steps and facets of planning a successful event. Become a professional event manager and register today.
courseDescription:
Events are celebrations that provide opportunities to meet and share ideas and happy moments with colleagues or loved ones. Apart from this, events are an integral part of professional life. Creating an event is no small feat. It takes planning and understanding of the process. When planning an event, there are many tasks to consider, which has created a significant demand for professional help in the form of an event manager or planner. This course takes the guesswork out of event management and event organisation by introducing you to all the tips and techniques needed for an event manager or planner to arrange an event successfully.

We have divided the course into two modules, each containing several topics, where you learn the basics of planning and managing an event. The lessons in the topics help you understand the process and steps of event management. You will discover the important principles and techniques for planning occasions and getting started as a professional event planner. Start by learning the basics of event management, the role of an event planner and how to organise successful meetings. Become familiar with various backend functions and tasks related to administration, staff, catering and vendor management before tackling the section on handling post-event activities. 

By the end of this course, you will have the potential and basic skills demanded from a professional event manager coordinator. This course is best suited for beginners and is perfect for those excited to work in the event management industry or who want to start their own business as event managers or planners. Explore more about the business and its procedures to ensure you arrange an event for the correct occasion. The knowledge gained in this course will help you plan a successful event or run a profitable event management company. Seize this exciting opportunity by enrolling today.

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital : a downloadable in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • : a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked , posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed : a physical version of your officially branded and security marked in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.

All are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison , please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison , you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. For more details on our pricing, please visit our Pricing Page
slides:
• Learning Outcomes

  • Having completed this module you will be able to:
    • Discuss in detail what event Management is.
    • Define the 5 C’s of event management.
    • Describe the role and responsibilities of an event planner and how he can manage a crisis.
    • Identify the skills required to be an event planner.
    • Describe different types of events and the various types of entertainments needed to keep people engaged.
    • Explain how to organize planning meetings for an event and engage clients and stakeholders effectively.
    • Describe the initial steps, process, and procedures for planning an event along with necessary elements.

  • Lesson Summary

    • Event management is a multi-million-pound industry that is growing at the rate of 150% per annum with the event being hosted almost daily.
    • Event management denotes the production of an event. Many people with different skills and roles are involved in its execution.
    • Event management is a thrilling and exciting career choice but can be daunting.
    • Event managers must double up as janitor one minute and fearless leader the next.
    • The 5C’s of event management are concept, coordination, control, culmination, and closeout.
    • Hosting events helps a brand gain exposure.
    • An event planner structures an event coordinates all of the moving parts and makes sure everyone has a good time.
    • The number one quality shared by successful event managers is people skills.
    • Multi-tasking prowess is required for both smooth planning and flawless execution of an event.
    • Crisis management is about those unexpected moments that can ruin a meeting or event.
    • A successful event career requires a wealth of skills, from a knack for detailed planning to high-level multitasking during event execution.

  • Learning Outcomes

  • Having completed this module you will be able to:
    • Describe the major types of support staff and administrative tasks needed for a successful event and their functions.
    • Identify the different types of technical staff needed for the smooth functioning of an event.
    • Recognize all the different types of vendors needed for carrying out an event.
    • Discuss how to finalize your ideas and confirm the choices and factors related to important aspects like venue, food, decor, and others.
    • Explain the importance of being organized and how you can get organized and save yourself the stress.
    • Describe the importance of event marketing, its steps, and its aspects.
    • Describe how to carry out post-event activities like feedback to help improve yourself.

  • Lesson Summary

    • Organized support staff helps make life a lot easier during an event. Some of the important and necessary support staff are security, Valet, Waiter/ Waitress, and the setup and cleanup crew.
    • The technical staff is as much important as the support staff. They set up, test, and fix the technical applications of the event. 
    • Some of the key technical staff are visual or lighting technicians, Media technicians for handling and running web and social media, Audio technicians, and specialized equipment technicians.
    • A vendor is an outside company that works with an event. Utilizing vendors efficiently is the key to a successful and cost-effective event. 
    • Some of the vendors include food vendors ie catering companies, Equipment vendors for supplying the equipment, decoration and furnishing vendors, and photography or video vendors.
    • Picking up a venue, The registration process, selecting the type of entertainment, and choosing cuisine and decor are key factors to an event.
    • The cuisine and decor of an event are directly related to the theme of the event.
    • Events give marketers a key opportunity to build relationships and trust with prospective customers by offering that personal touch that digital can often lack.
    • Event marketing is the promotion of a product, brand, or service through in-person interactions.
